title: A plan.
content:
A possible scenario:

We setup something anyway, tweak it up and get it all ready, and then open registrations without allowing posting except in a general forum. Then once we have enough people to hopefully warrant a switchover, and assuming we don't hear anything from Cho'gall for another few months, it's just a matter of setting a couple of options to activate it as a replacement, and closing most of the forums here.

Who has a reliable server to volunteer for something like this?

title: Re: A plan.
content: I'll set up a forum, but last time I checked chogall was in the process of setting one up.  Then he vanished..[url=http://spatang.com/ck][img]http://spatang.com/ck/bannersm.jpg[/img][/url] [url=http://spatang.com/cosmo][img]http://spatang.com/cosmo/bannersm.jpg[/img][/url] [url=http://spatang.com/nukem][img]http://www.spatang.com/nukem/bannersm.jpg[/img][/url] [img]http://spatang.com/scrobblersig.php[/img]

title: Re: A plan.
content:
What'd be cool is to have all 3 forums on one site (not necessarily on one forum, though), and have one account work for all 3. The main page of the site would link to all 3 forums, and have things like announcements and stuff.
But that's asking for a little too much...-Genius314
[url=http://planetck.spatang.com]PlanetCK[/url]

title: Commander Keen Dot Whatever - A Vision
content:
I think that's what xtra was trying to achieve with DOSClassics/Spatang, but without an active forum it didn't really have enough users and so it fell into disrepair. (It seems to be filled with spam at the moment.)

What would be really great would be an integrated community site another step on from anything we have at the moment. It'd have the forums and wiki, and would probably have an upload system like DOSClassics. It would borrow elements from sites like KeenRush's Mod Maze and Gnosticus VII - which was a review site for mods run by allstories, in case anyone had forgotten. There'd also be a blog/news page, and a bunch of articles about level design and community history and stuff (many of which already exist, so we'd only have to find and upload them). It wouldn't even necessarily have to be on one server - I'm sure a distributed login system wouldn't be too hard to implement.

In a sentence, it would be an archive for everything the community has ever done.

Were I running it (not that I'm suggesting that would necessarily be a good idea), I'd register the domain for at least five years and host it with someone like [url=http://www.nearlyfreespeech.net]NearlyFreeSpeech.NET[/url], who charge by the byte and allow anyone to donate to your hosting account. That way, we wouldn't have an unfortunate incident like with commanderkeen.net, where the domain and hosting account vanished because someone forgot to renew them.[url=http://toxicsheep.com]toxicsheep.com[/url] | [url=http://commanderkeen.org]coming up next...[/url]

title: Re: Planet Keen
content:
[hr]grafix There'd also be a blog/news page, and a bunch of articles about level design and community history and stuff
[hr]I hope to accomplish something like this with planetkeen.com. It's a pretty basic concept currently, but my PHP/MySQL abilities have improved somewhat since I last worked on it a few months ago.

However, if anyone can beat me to the punch with something better, go for it.

title: Re: Commander Keen Dot Whatever - A Vision
content:
That is what I intended with Dosclassics, but as grafix said, without an active userbase I lost interest in maintaining it. This is still a realistic possibility, probably possible by reusing a lot of the code I've done, but we need to decide what elements should be part of the entire portal, and over what servers it will be distributed. I have no plans to take down the spatang server and if I ever decide to I will make the arrangements to pass it to someone who wants it in the community, so I'm fine with having the core stuff there.

Elements:
Userbase system (obviously)
PCKF
Keen: Modding (dunno if this needs to be integrated necessarily, but at least easily accessible from the portal)
Wiki
combined game and review system (upload capabilities included)
blog/devlog features for each user
article system
active projects for each user (tied in to devlogs?)

A good deal of this already exists in dosclassics although I think that the entirity of the ancient downloads that are filled up in that should be put in some archive and then the database wiped, so the content can accurately reflect the community at this current time.[url=http://spatang.com/ck][img]http://spatang.com/ck/bannersm.jpg[/img][/url] [url=http://spatang.com/cosmo][img]http://spatang.com/cosmo/bannersm.jpg[/img][/url] [url=http://spatang.com/nukem][img]http://www.spatang.com/nukem/bannersm.jpg[/img][/url] [img]http://spatang.com/scrobblersig.php[/img]

title: Re: Commander Keen Dot Whatever - A Vision
content:
Well I really like the "single sign on" idea, so whatever happens I think we should aim to integrate all the usernames and passwords. [url=http://www.openid.net]OpenID[/url] has the right idea, but I don't think it's practical typing in a whole URL as a login name. We need something similar but easier just for the Keen community. (With a nice picture of Keen in the username field, like OpenID do with their logo!)

I'd be only too happy to tweak the KeenWiki's login system to recognise these "distributed accounts", and I'm sure Andy would do the same for K:M.

title: Re: Commander Keen Dot Whatever - A Vision
content:
Of course, we'd have to change so much to get it to work properly. I don't know much about how it'd work, but it seems like we'd have to start from scratch to rebuild everything with the new system, on the new site, with new user accounts.
But I'm willing to go through all of that, as long as we stop using EZboard!!-Genius314
[url=http://planetck.spatang.com]PlanetCK[/url]

title: Re: Commander Keen Dot Whatever - A Vision
content: I think it's only 22 hours out for me, so your post was on "3/28/07 11:44am" so I have to subtract two hours which makes 9:44am, then switch am/pm so it's 9:44pm, and it was posted on the 3rd, but today's the 29th, oh wait it's American format so it was really the 28th, then add a day to make it the 29th, so you posted it on the 29th at 9:44pm, which is half a day into the future, so no, that's not right...
